Description: Fragment of floor of East Greek black-figured pottery stemmed bowl; attachment of stem part-preserved on underside. Bands at top of stem, one with added red band lined in white; frieze of rays or billets at base of wall; inside: remains of black-figured animal frieze on lower wall (goat to right and feline to left identifiable); stopt maeander frieze towards centre; disc and three rings at centre, surrounded by whirligig of seven griffin protomes, interspersed with dot rosettes;glaze bands with added red bands lined in white between friezes.
Curator's comments: Picked up by Petrie (Journal 1884-5, p. 72). Register has Temenos of Apollo.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 52)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1097)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 983, pl. 121)
